content:
Personal: Emails unrelated to work, such as travel, family, and entertainment 
Entities: [topic (examples: March break hotel, child's baseball game, doctor's appointment), sender (examples: Robert Geffin, Gray School, Samantha)]

Absence: The user needs to inform the professor of their absence from class. 
Entities: [student (examples: Julia Terry, Amber, Loring), class (examples: Introduction to Linguistics, Geopolitics, BIO11), date (examples: Thursday, the 19th, April 16)]

Technical: Information pertaining to running courses, including the LMS system, registrar, and other university-controlled technologies that are involved with running a course 
Entities: [technology (examples: Canvas, IT, course registration), class (examples: CS503, Humanities Seminar, Italy and the World)]

Spam: Unwanted messages offering deals, promotions, false jobs, etc.  
Entities: []

A renowned Computer Science professor at the University of Buffalo is having a headache with how much email he receives. He is trying to build an automatic system for sorting his emails so that he can focus on one task at a time. His plan is to only have certain folders of email visible to himself at a time so that he can schedule specific time to deal with each class, his advisees, and whichever such designations he chooses. His husband insists that all family-related emails must always show up and alert him, so he is trying to design a system that will have this behavior. You are a classifier in one of his tests. 

In the context, you can see 4 categories that classify intent of emails received by a professor. Each is accompanied with entities. Please classify the following email, and include all entities. The classification should be in json format. Every entity that is included in the description must be included in the output, but N/A is acceptable. 

Dear Sir, 

My name is Maria and I would like to inform you that I will not be able to attend class on April 14th as it is a holiday in my religion. I have attached a letter from my worship center. Please inform me what I can do to not fall behind. 

Regards, 

Ms. Camila
